descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
Continuation of MENU 321-2. Lebesgue measure and integration. Sequence covers more topics, more abstractly, at a faster pace, and in greater depth than 320-1,2 and emphasizes analyzing and creating proofs.
Students may not receive credit for both 320-1 and 321-1 or both 320-2 and 321-2. Prerequisite: average grade of A or above in 291, A- or above in 334, A in 300, B or above in 331, or consent of the department.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Prerequisite: average grade of A or above in 291, A- or above in 334, A in 300, B or above in 331, or consent of the department.

descriptions.value:
Real Analysis
Fitzspatrick and Royden
Prentice Hall
ISBN: 978-0131437470

A (Terse) Introduction to Lebesgue Integration
John Franks
American Mathematical Society
ISBN: 978-0821848623

descriptions.name: Class Notes
descriptions.value: Students may not receive credit for both 320-1 and 321-1 or both 320-2 and 321-2.
